intro: Streptocarpus woodii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces clusters of violet-blue or white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Streptocarpus woodii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
